title: 111_hr4632
content: The Act titled "Renovate and Enhance Veterans' Meeting Halls and Posts Act of 2010" or "REVAMP Act of 2010" provides competitive grants to veterans service organizations for facility rehabilitation. The "REVAMP Act of 2010" provides competitive grants to eligible veterans service organizations for repairs and rehabilitation of existing facilities on a competitive basis. Eligible organizations must be tax-exempt under section 501(c)(19) of the Internal Revenue Code. The "REVAMP Act of 2010" provides competitive grants to eligible veterans service organizations for repairs and rehabilitation of existing facilities. Eligible organizations must be tax-exempt under section 501(c)(19) of the Internal Revenue Code. The grant amounts are limited for each fiscal year. The "REVAMP Act of 2010" offers competitive grants to tax-exempt veterans service organizations for facility repairs and rehabilitation. Grant amounts are capped at the lesser of the proposed project cost or $200,000 per fiscal year. Organizations receiving grants are ineligible for further funding for the next 5 fiscal years. Applications must be submitted by eligible organizations following specific procedures set by the Secretary. Applications for grants under the "REVAMP Act of 2010" must include a plan for repair or rehabilitation activities. The Secretary will select recipients based on criteria such as the extent of need, quality of the proposed plan, applicant's capacity to carry out the plan, and other relevant factors. Grant funds cannot be used for construction or acquisition. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to allocate $50,000,000 annually for grants under section 107(g). The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will issue necessary regulations for implementation. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development shall issue regulations to implement sections 106(a)(4) and 107(g) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 within 90 days of the enactment of this Act.
